title: Support Changes

embed.description: Greetings, Summoners. This patch is a bit of a grab bag, with good stuff all around. We've got a broader assortment of changes than we can cover in an intro, but we'll do our best to hit the highlights. Ryze's update leads us off.

body: The latest patch says "Support grades specifically weigh assists equal to kills, leaving one fewer excuse for bloodthirsty Flash-Ignites". Now I main Leona, does support apply to Leona or no because the game calls her a tank, but her secondary is support, yet I always play her as support.

replies.body: Role selects your placement on the map which could be something the grading system looks at when you appear in that lane.  It's also not just specific to a role, but t a lot of other factors too.  The grading system might look into other things like map position, spells, and a variety of different things that we don't have details on.   Unfortunately, the specifics are not something we have a lot of visibility on beyond the guide previously linked, but I hope that helps.
That makes me wonder, how does it grade in blind pick when roles aren't defined beforehand.

The system doesn't depend on the role selection in SR Draft Pick to determine your role as you can swap roles / lanes.

The system determines your role by your lane (in-game) for the first few minutes, on Twisted Treeline and Summoner's Rift. If you're ADC on TT or SR, the game will detect you as an ADC after the first 2 - 3 minutes.

The grading score should look at the role that you're playing the champion in, and not necessarily the champion's characteristic.  For example, if I selected to play Kayle as an ADC Role then the grading system would score me against other ADC Kayles.  Your score with Leona would be graded in a similar why if you selected Support as your role.  Be sure to check out our [Champion Mastery Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204211284-Champion-Mastery-Guide) for more insight on how grading works.  Hope that helps!
